pyramid.plunder

Class PhysicsObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • pyramid.plunder.Drawable
      • pyramid.plunder.GameObject
        • pyramid.plunder.PhysicsObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Coin, HealthOrb, Loot, Platform, Player

    public abstract class PhysicsObject
extends GameObject
    This class creates guidelines for the physics behind movement in the game. It includes velocity along with gravity.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean gravity 
      float[] velocity 

      • Fields inherited from class pyramid.plunder.GameObject

        drawKey, imageKeys, isPlayer, keyTime, name

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhysicsObject(int[] imageKeys)
      This method creates the an object in the game that is effected by gravity.
      PhysicsObject(int[] imageKeys, boolean gravityOn)
      This method creates turns gravity on for an object in the game.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addJump()
      This method adds one to the jump indicator for the object, since the main character only has a limited number of jumps.
      boolean collide(GameObject g)
      This method tests whether or not the object has collided with another on screen object.
      boolean collidesBox(int[] locOne, int[] sizeOne, int[] locTwo, int[] sizeTwo)
      This method creates a collision box for the object and considers whether or not it is in the same box as a another object on screen.
      void Draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method draws the new frame for a moving object and updates it's velocity and the effects gravity has on it.
      int getJumps()
      This method returns the objects number of jumps.
      float[] getVelocity()
      This method returns the objects velocity.
      void setVelocity(float[] velocity)
      This method sets the objects velocity.
      void updatePhysics()
      This method updates the physics for the object and compares defines its new location along with its old location.

      • Draw

        public void Draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws the new frame for a moving object and updates it's velocity and the effects gravity has on it.
        Overrides:
        Draw in class GameObject

      • updatePhysics

        public void updatePhysics()
        This method updates the physics for the object and compares defines its new location along with its old location. Also the object is given an updated velocity based on how it's moving. Jumping is also taken into account.

      • collidesBox

        public boolean collidesBox(int[] locOne,
                  int[] sizeOne,
                  int[] locTwo,
                  int[] sizeTwo)
        This method creates a collision box for the object and considers whether or not it is in the same box as a another object on screen.

      • getVelocity

        This method returns the objects velocity.

        This method sets the objects velocity.

        This method adds one to the jump indicator for the object, since the main character only has a limited number of jumps.

        This method returns the objects number of jumps.
